para.text: In General. Except as provided in §B of this regulation, this chapter applies to all campaign finance reports required by Election Law Article, §13-304, Annotated Code of Maryland, to be filed with the State Board.
This chapter does not apply to a campaign finance report for which the State Board has granted an exemption under Election Law Article, §13-324(a), Annotated Code of Maryland.
An application for an exemption shall be filed on the form and by the deadline specified by the State Administrator.
A political committee is eligible for a waiver of the electronic filing requirements if the political committee:
Provides a reasonable explanation as to why the treasurer cannot file electronically;
Has a cash balance, less the amount of outstanding obligations, equal to or less than $3,000; and
Has less than 20 transactions during the reporting period.
A waiver remains in effect until the political committee:
Files a campaign finance report electronically; or
Exceeds the eligibility requirements of §B(3) of this regulation.
A political committee may not request another waiver in the same calendar year that the initial waiver was granted.
Filing Method. A campaign finance report shall be filed electronically by means of the browser-based software provided by the State Administrator.

Campaign finance reports shall include, in a format approved by the State Administrator, an attestation by the filer, under penalties of perjury, that the contents of the electronic filing are a complete and accurate statement of the campaign finance activity.
Campaign finance reports filed electronically shall include all other information or materials required by the State Administrator.
